trope_name trope_url description

"Chekhov MIA" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovMIA "If a character related to another major character goes missing at some point in a long-running series, they will appear again."

"Chekhovs Army" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsArmy "A whole bunch of often unrelated minor characters all become important later."
"Chekhovs Boomerang" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsBoomerang "A plot device that has already been used once, then unexpectedly turns up again."
"Chekhovs Classroom" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsClassroom "If you're taught something irrelevant in a story, expect to apply that knowledge later."
"Chekhovs Exhibit" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsExhibit "If attention is called to a well-protected valuable object on display, it's gonna get stolen before the end of the episode."
"Chekhovs Gag" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGag "That joke was funny! It's also important later on!"
"Chekhovs Gift" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGift "Character A has received a gift from Character B in the past. Expect it to be important to the plot later."
"Chekhovs Gun" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGun "A plot device that isn't significant until later in the story."
"Chekhovs Gunman" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGunman "Earlier-introduced minor character is actually very important."
"Chekhovs Hobby" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsHobby "A character is said to possess an irrelevant skill early on, and that skill becomes useful later."
"Chekhovs News" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsNews "The news reports on something seemingly minor or insignificant, but the subject becomes plot relevant later."
"Chekhovs Party" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsParty "If a party is mentioned, whether on- or offscreen, you can guarantee something important happened there."
"Chekhovs Skill" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsSkill "A previously noted skill or talent becomes essential to the plot."

"RPG Mechanics Verse" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RPGMechanicsVerse "A setting in which game mechanics like hit points, skill checks, and character alignments exist in-universe."
"RP Gs Equal Combat" http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RPGsEqualCombat "You're led to believe there are a variety of different ways to progress, but they all revolve around killing."
